0.NAME: Akira Yamaoka
0.EXPLANATION:
Once the sole champion of this Coliseum, nobody
knows why he left or even returned. The only thing
for certain is that he is still the strongest and
still the hungriest for blood.

1.NAME: Hannya Kurokawa
1.EXPLANATION:
A masked man of unknown origins, it is said that
staring into his eyes through the mask will shorten
your life, and just a glimpse of his maskless face
means death. His opponents face a merciless fate.

2.NAME: Ivan Ibrahimovic
2.EXPLANATION:
All of his past losses were apparently faked. This
superhuman boasts that he has never been KO'd.
His unparalleled physique alone is enough to make
anyone who dares face him think twice.

3.NAME: Adabana
3.EXPLANATION:
The legend who surpassed the legendary sumo
champion Raiden. He faced tragedy when he was
forced to retire after snapping the
neck of an opponent with a deadly slap.

4.NAME: Kaname Ginga
4.EXPLANATION:
In every era and field, there is always someone
whose skills are unparalleled, as if that person
is blessed by the gods. Ginga is this man at the
Underground Coliseum.

5.NAME: Valery Garrett
5.EXPLANATION:
His origins and reason for fighting are hidden under a
veil of mystery. His powerful punches have put numerous
great fighters into retirement. Truly the strongest man
alive, it is said that demons dwell within his fists.

6.NAME: Sotaro Komaki
6.EXPLANATION:
Martial arts expert and founder of the mysterious
Komaki technique. His unfading strength is ever-
evolving. He continues fighting to challenge
himself and spread the Komaki arts.

7.NAME: Inzen Hozoin
7.EXPLANATION:
The successor of the Hozoin spear technique, passed
down from the Azuchi-Momoyama Period. His superior
spear skills and movements are on par with the style's
founder, Inei. He fights to spread the Hozoin spirit.

8.NAME: Rayzy
8.EXPLANATION:
A former star of action films that featured real
fighting, his life turned to tragedy and despair
when he went beyond acting and killed a co-star.

9.NAME: Rei Himuro
9.EXPLANATION:
A mysterious man with a reputation for using everyday
items like business cards, pens, and watches as
deadly weapons. He is forbidden from exchanging
business cards with other fighters for this reason.

10.NAME: Kurotaka
10.EXPLANATION:
A masked pro-wrestler banned from the ring
after numerous wrongdoings. He came to
the Underground Coliseum to fight, but aims
to exact revenge on the pro-wrestling world.

11.NAME: Romeo Nishikawa
11.EXPLANATION:
Dominate, plunder, and win everything竭ｬin a
way, he personifies basic human nature.
Rumored to be a sensitive softie outside the
ring, inside he is a powerful fighting tyrant.

12.NAME: Nobu Yamamoto
12.EXPLANATION:
A deep hatred of foreign fighters pushes this man
to fight with everything he has. His reasons seem
to spawn from his childhood. If only he would fight
everyone with such heart...

13.NAME: Robin Ashbourne
13.EXPLANATION:
A noteworthy fighter who boasts that his roar is
capable of devastating everything around him.
Those in the know say his presence is boosting
attendance at the Underground Coliseum.

14.NAME: Laos Waiwatt
14.EXPLANATION:
His influence has awarded him the title "Waiwatt of
Thailand," and his uniquely timed kicks have broken
the bodies and souls of countless kickboxers. His
momentum kicks on at the Underground Coliseum.

15.NAME: Shoji Yonashiro
15.EXPLANATION:
A Ryukyu martial arts expert from Okinawa. His old-
style skills and nunchaku abilities are said to be
master level. The excitement of Kamurocho has
led him astray from his journey for the past year.

16.NAME: Norman C. Wade
16.EXPLANATION:
A raging giant who can only be stopped in the
ring by his handlers. His penchant for violence
has led to problems outside the ring. He comes
in search of a place to sate his lust for violence.

17.NAME: Mike Berheart
17.EXPLANATION:
A fighter from a proud warrior tribe. Raised by
mother nature, his muscles serve as both armor
and a launch pad for fierce attacks. He came to
the Underground Coliseum in search of money.

18.NAME: Otaki Minotaur
18.EXPLANATION:
Using his strength as his weapon, Minotaur
dominates the wrestling scene. He fights in the
Underground Coliseum to prove the superiority
of pro-wrestling over all fighting styles.

19.NAME: Torakichi Onigashima
19.EXPLANATION:
Once top of the sumo world, he was expelled
from the ring due to bad behavior. However,
his passion for sumo remains, and he still
performs the ceremonial "shiko" stomp.

20.NAME: Utamaro VII
20.EXPLANATION:
This up-and-coming kabuki fighter has a strange
motto: "The blood of others is as valuable as money
raining down." What will the crowd's reaction to his
fights be: roaring cheers or terrified screams?

21.NAME: Count Albert
21.EXPLANATION:
He claims to be a descendant of Vlad the Impaler,
representing a long line of vampires. Will he be
able to fill his elegant yet bland life with his
favorite dessert: "the Kill"?

22.NAME: Jaon
22.EXPLANATION:
A grudge brought him back from hell,
reincarnating him as a warrior in the Coliseum.
He seeks to rest in peace after winning the
tournament, but that is not likely to happen soon.

23.NAME: Mister Chen
23.EXPLANATION:
One would not imagine that this brutal fighter
is actually a calm Chinese cook in Little Asia
on his days off. His stage makeup is apparently
the source of his strength.

24.NAME: Kyoya Kawasaki
24.EXPLANATION:
This buzzworthy fighter single-handedly established
the genre of the "Crazed Stud." Fans eagerly await his
first sacrifice in the ring, but he has yet to deliver.

25.NAME: S. G. Jack
25.EXPLANATION:
He wrestled as a heel, but one day he suddenly
became a face without notice. That got him
ousted from his organization. He now uses his
exceptional skills here for his payday.

26.NAME: Dead Boy Jr.
26.EXPLANATION:
A street fighting specialist from Japan's largest
gang with a fighting record proven through
numerous hellacious experiences. He fights
to boost his gang's presence in the underground.

27.NAME: Kintaro Izaka
27.EXPLANATION:
This golden-haired boxer is skilled at dishing out
super-fast punch combos. Not satisfied with money
from boxing alone, he decided to fight here because
of the gigantic fight purse.

28.NAME: Captain Hideaway
28.EXPLANATION:
Despite his accomplishments he suffers from social
phobias and wears a mask to escape his fears.
Threatened by official deathmatches that might lead
to his unmasking, he now fights underground.

29.NAME: Bleeder Rouge
29.EXPLANATION:
Numerous rumors associate this masked fighter with
the famed Mon Amour Komiyama. True or not,
nobody knows what has brought this fighter to
where he is today.

30.NAME: Jon Carter
30.EXPLANATION:
Despite his amazing fighting instincts, he lost his
license due to his ties with the mafia. He tried to
stage comebacks, but to no avail. Recruited by a
scout, he now fights at the Underground Coliseum.

31.NAME: Hunter Ozawa
31.EXPLANATION:
A fighting pro who has faced death countless
times on the battlefield as a merc. He'll carry
out any mission for money. He trains at the
Underground Coliseum when he has no work.

32.NAME: William Clerc
32.EXPLANATION:
By day he's a famous CEO for an IT company,
but spends large sums on training to become
a stronger fighter. His training has led him to
the Underground Coliseum.

33.NAME: Headhunter Kariya
33.EXPLANATION:
This famous fighter is known for his giant axe.
Despite several wins, he boasts that no one has
witnessed his true skill. He used to heave his axe
into the crowd when he lost, but not anymore.

34.NAME: Kamata
34.EXPLANATION:
A former top-ranked soccer player, he now fights at
the Underground Coliseum to prove that soccer is the
number one sport. He apparently works as a television
commentator on his days off.

35.NAME: Death Volley Sawai
35.EXPLANATION:
This fighter is unique in his fighting tactics that make
use of volleyball techniques. His signature spike
blows have earned him numerous KOs, and he
continues to fight to strengthen this individual style.

36.NAME: Zombino Shibusawa
36.EXPLANATION:
Some say that this fighter learned all of his skills
from videos that he ordered online. Despite a level
of training that exceeds all others, his lack of real
experience has resulted in a streak of losses.

37.NAME: Raging Joe
37.EXPLANATION:
The vanguard of Underworld, a motorcycle gang. He
fought like a maniac in their turf wars, so his boss
sent him to the Coliseum to let off steam. But in spite
of the boss's intentions, he looks even more ready to brawl.

38.NAME: Renji Kamiyama
38.EXPLANATION:
Runs an armory in Kamurocho. He uses
unbelievably nimble moves while using his
favorite weapons. Fights reluctantly at the Coliseum,
on weapons master Shoji Yonashiro's orders.

39.NAME: Tomahawk Mitsui
39.EXPLANATION:
Nicknamed the Unexpected Machine for winning
numerous title matches against all odds. He joined
the Underground Coliseum to prove that all of his
wins were not in fact rigged.

40.NAME: Don Carpaccio
40.EXPLANATION:
This kickboxer's flashy moves and extraordinarily
precise tactics send opponents straight to the
mat. A veteran of the Underground Coliseum, he
knows exactly how to win the grand prix.

41.NAME: Bruce Ebinuma
41.EXPLANATION:
His origins and reason for fighting are hidden under
a veil of mystery. However, his graceful moves will
remind you of a certain man. It's fair to say that he
is the reincarnation of a legend.

42.NAME: Mammoth Tatsu
42.EXPLANATION:
He built his underground reputation by spending
his whole life fighting, conquering numerous
adversaries with his soulful strikes. His fighting
style remains the same, captivating fans.

43.NAME: Grand Chef Cho
43.EXPLANATION:
A cook who has put his efforts into his own form of
gourmet fighting. Exceptional with knives, his cutting
speed has set new records. He now makes full use of
his unique style at the Underground Coliseum.

44.NAME: Kazuhiro
44.EXPLANATION:
This man went too far on his blog and bragged he was
the best fighter. Now, to prove he wasn't lying, he
fights at the Underground Coliseum. He's oblivious to
the fact that he can't blog about the underground fights...

45.NAME: Hideo Sugiyama
45.EXPLANATION:
Taiga Saejima's first apprentice, Sugiyama began
fighting to win over a girl that he liked. He failed
at love, but succeeded at becoming a superb,
balanced fighter. His glasses are purely for fashion.

46.NAME: Takehiro Ehama
46.EXPLANATION:
Taiga Saejima's second apprentice, Ehama began
fighting after being laid off from his job. As a side
note, he was apparently let go for delivering the
boss a caffﾃｨ latte when he wanted a caffﾃｨ mocha.

47.NAME: Fukushi Ochiai
47.EXPLANATION:
Taiga Saejima's third apprentice, Ochiai apparently
likes Sodachi Dojo, as he's always using the place
for naps. Nobody at the dojo has noticed, but he's
a famous writer for a popular magazine column.

48.NAME: Makoto Tokita
48.EXPLANATION:
Taiga Saejima's fourth apprentice. A born narcissist,
Tokita's hobby is looking at himself in the mirror.
His conceit once drove him to ignore the feelings of
others, but Saejima has now changed that.

49.NAME: Masataka Watanabe
49.EXPLANATION:
Taiga Saejima's final apprentice, a youth with a kind
heart. Being called fat once made Watanabe avoid
opening up to others, but training's transformed him.
He likes oolong tea and drinks about five liters a day.

50.NAME: Fredrick Blacks
50.EXPLANATION:
Unmatched in the kickboxing circuit, he was
unable to show off his true potential. This
led him to the Underground Coliseum, in
search of a worthy opponent.

51.NAME: Lionel Klinsmann
51.EXPLANATION:
Expelled from his country's boxing circuit for
gambling, he arrived at the Underground
Coliseum in search of a fight. He is known for
his nimble footwork and hard punching power.

52.NAME: Kyosuke Muguruma
52.EXPLANATION:
Despite his solid reputation as a grand master,
he left his respected karate dojo in his pursuit of
strength. He joined the Underground Coliseum,
abandoning his rank, honor, and black belt.

53.NAME: Antonio Vaquero
53.EXPLANATION:
A technical boxer who nimbly evades attacks
just like a bullfighter. He came all the way
from Spain after hearing about a tournament
where only the strongest fighters compete.

54.NAME: Scorpio Kito
54.EXPLANATION:
His killer knee kick dominates Japan's kickboxing
circuit. He became the youngest to break numerous
fighting records. Official fights weren't enough for him,
so he now competes in the Underground Coliseum.

55.NAME: Seiji Higuchi
55.EXPLANATION:
Head of a biker gang based in Kamurocho.
Earned his position by winning a large number
of fights. Fights tag matches with his friend
Shogo Usui to spread the name of his biker gang.

56.NAME: Shogo Usui
56.EXPLANATION:
Leader of a hoodlum group based in Kamurocho.
His show of strength during matches has attracted
numerous new members. Fights with his
old friend Seiji Higuchi in tag matches.

57.NAME: Yi-san
57.EXPLANATION:
A kung fu expert along with his partner, Er-san.
His magnificent techniques performed from a
unique kung fu stance are unmatched in grace.
Coliseum fighting is part of his athletic training.

58.NAME: Er-san
58.EXPLANATION:
A kung fu expert along with his partner, Yi-san.
He is gentle and well respected, but ruthless
against opponents once in the ring. Coliseum
fighting is part of his athletic training.

59.NAME: Justin Woods
59.EXPLANATION:
A boxer who dominates the sport with his
ferocious punching rushes. His unrivaled
strength has earned him numerous title belts.
Fights in tag matches with Dong-Joo Park.

60.NAME: Dong-Joo Park
60.EXPLANATION:
A well-respected hit man for the Korean
mafia underground. It's said that not even a
speck of dust is left after he finishes. He fights
to boost Korea's reputation in the underground.

61.NAME: Gunji Tachibana
61.EXPLANATION:
Failing to find mainstream work, he became a
street brawler. But when he heard about the Coliseum,
he decided to join. Although he has no pro experience,
his skills speak for themselves. The next rising star.

62.NAME: Keisuke Uematsu
62.EXPLANATION:
A fearless new fighter who has never lost a
fight. He joined the Underground Coliseum to
earn more money. His ham-fisted style still needs
work, but his spirit and courage are tops.

63.NAME: Ginjiro Izaka
63.EXPLANATION:
A talented silver-haired boxer with a super fast
combo. Dissatisfied with boxing prize money,
he decided to fight at the Underground Coliseum to
try his hand at winning its immense fight purse.
